articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: JAMES McCARTHY was a Wembley winner on the day Wigan shocked Joe Hart and Manchester City in one of the biggest English Cup Final upsets of all time. The Glasgow-born midfielder was outstanding for Roberto Martinez’s so-called no-hopers as they toppled the Etihad giants 1-0 with a last-minute goal from Ben Watson on May 11 2013. [...]
articles.title: THE STRANGE CASE OF JOE HART AND JAMES McCARTHY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MATT O’RILEY will be forgiven for expecting he would showcasing his talents in soccer’s showpiece in Germany this month. The in-form playmaker stormed through the season in convincing fashion with 18 assists and 19 goals as he played a monumental role in Brendan Rodgers’ side’s double-winning campaign. O’Riley had been tipped by many neutral observers [...]
articles.title: MATT O’RILEY: ‘WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: JOE HART brought his memorable three years at Celtic to a halt a week ago today. It was fitting the much-decorated keeper should go out as a winner with a clean sheet and yet another medal. Hart played his part in the 1-0 Scottish Cup showpiece victory over Philippe Clement’s Ibrox side at Hampden on [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: GOALKEEPERS, GUNSLINGERS AND GOLDFISH

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: AUTHOR Alex Gordon was present on the day Celtic unveiled Martin O’Neill as their new manager 24 years ago today. Alex, who is a former sports editor of the best-selling Sunday Mail during a lengthy career in journalism, has had fifteen Celtic books published, including ‘Lisbon Lions: The 40th Anniversary Celebration‘, and ‘50 Flags Plus [...]
articles.title: ‘SERIOUSLY, I DO BEAR GRUDGES. HONESTLY, I DO,’ NEW CELTIC MANAGER’S THREAT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MARTIN O’NEILL believes his five seasons at Celtic are only surpassed by the achievements of Jock Stein’s Lisbon Lions. The ebullient Northern Irishman took over at Parkhead exactly TWENTY-FOUR YEARS ago today to kick-start an extraordinary silverware landslide. And O’Neill insists the class of 2003 should have followed Stein’s side by lifting a European trophy. The [...]
articles.title: 18 TITLES IN 24 YEARS: ‘WE LIT THE FUSE’

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: European football news this week featured Vincent Kompany “failing up”.  After overseeing Burnley’s relegation from the topflight of English football, the affable Belgian was appointed manager of Bayern Munich.  Charm gets you places, people! Hot on the heels of that, the Newco chief executive James Bisgrove handed in his resignation, he’s off to work his [...]
articles.title: Failing up in football

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON has won five honours in his year and a half at Celtic. The Canadian World Cup right-back hoovered up a domestic treble in quickfire fashion after arriving in a £3.5million switch from MLS outfit CF Montreal in January last year. And the tenacious defender enjoyed second successive triumphs in the Premiership and the [...]
articles.title: ‘SERIAL WINNER,’ JOHNSTON HAILS RODGERS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: FORMER Celtic star Thomas Gravesen has led the furious reaction from Denmark fans at Matt O’Riley’s shock omission from the international squad for the Euro 24 Finals in Germany. The stylish playmaker was overlooked by Danish head coach Kasper Hjulmand when he announced his 26-man pool, as CQN reported yesterday. The London-born Hoops star looked [...]
articles.title: O’RILEY SNUB: EX-CELT LEADS DANISH FURY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S double winner Matt O’Riley will miss OUT on next month’s Euro 24 Finals in Germany. Denmark head coach Kasper Hjulmand has astoundingly overlooked the champions’ star performer after CQN stated earlier today the international boss didn’t rate the Premiership. However, we still believed O’Riley had contributed enough to earn a place in his adopted [...]
articles.title: SHOCKER AS O’RILEY MISSES OUT

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: They all move on eventually but suggestions that Kyogo (29) will head to Urawa Red Diamonds in Japan this summer are fanciful. The player is at the peak of his powers and has just finished a season when he scored crucial goals against Newco that swung the most important games of the term, as well [...]
articles.title: Kyogo is not a cheap diamond

articles.description: MATT O’RILEY is poised to take centre stage in next month’s Euro 24 Finals when transfer speculation is bound to be ramped up. O’Riley, who swept up the club’s Player of the Year awards, also shared the distinction of [...]
articles.title: O’RILEY POISED FOR EURO 24 SPOTLIGHT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS is stepping up his goalkeeper chase as he seeks TWO new shotstoppers at the champions. Joe Hart, at the age of 37 and after three glorious years at Parkhead, has retired following his last-ever appearance in the 1-0 Scottish Cup Final at Hampden at the weekend. Benji Siegrist, 31, has not figured at [...]
articles.title: RODGERS STEPS UP KEEPER CHASE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: OH HYEON-GYU looks to be heading for the exit as he leads a Celtic clear-out. The South Korean striker, bought by Ange Postecoglou for £2million in January 2022, has become a bit-part player since the arrival of Brendan Rodgers last June. Oh, 23, has made just three league starts in his 20 appearances this season [...]
articles.title: OH LEADS CELTIC CLEAR-OUT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC could more than DOUBLE their money if they are tempted to allow Kyogo Furuhashi to leave the champions this summer. Reports have emerged that J-League giants Urawa Red Diamonds are preparing an ambitious record-breaking bid to take the striker back to Japan. The Hoops paid Vissel Kobe £4.6million for the 29-year-old fans’ favourite in July [...]
articles.title: KYOGO: DOUBLE YOUR MONEY

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Claims that Newco dominated the Scottish Cup Final (made by formerly credible outlets) are clearly untrue, but although Celtic shaded all the important metrics, there was little between the sides. We had the ability to get the better of Newco in tight games all season.  Brendan Rodgers will be happy with this, but Philippe Clement [...]
articles.title: Rodgers and Clement will both be encouraged

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR has urged Celtic to snap up Paulo Bernardo in the summer. The Hoops skipper admits he has been impressed by the on-loan Benfica playmaker who is valued around the £6.3million mark by the Lisbon giants. Bernardo, 22, has made 33 appearances in the Hoops’ double-winning season to welcome back Brendan Rodgers back to the [...]
articles.title: ‘IMPORTANT,’ McGREGOR CALL FOR BERNARDO DEAL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ADAM IDAH’S valuation appears to have TREBLED in his four months of action at Celtic. The figure of £3million was originally mentioned when the 23-year-old Norwich City bit-part player arrived at Parkhead in a loan deal on January deadline day. Idah has scored nine goals over the period, including, of course, the last-minute Scottish Cup winner against Philippe [...]
